ColumnVarValue.Description: This function is used to get variable's value at current column of auto report's context.
ColumnVarValue.Name: ColumnVarValue

ExecVar.Description: This function gets the Report Variables from the parent report.
ExecVar.Name: ExecVar

FieldVar.Description: This function is used to get the values from the variable whose value is changing in a field. This function is useful in multi-column reports where the value of the variable changes frequently in a Field. It accepts a single parameter namely the variable name and returns the value based on the type of Variable.
FieldVar.Name: FieldVar

HighValue.Description: This function provides the End Date for the current periodicity. For Example, when you select Quarterly, Half Yearly or Yearly as a periodicity in the report it will return the end date for that period.
HighValue.Name: HighValue

IsActualsVar.Description: The function $$IsActualsVar is used to verify whether the content of the variable which is passed as a parameter has a content 'Actuals' or not. If the content of the variable is 'Actuals' then it returns a logical value 'Yes' otherwise returns a logical value 'No'.
IsActualsVar.Name: IsActualsVar

IsCommon.Description: This function is used with repeated variable to check for the duplicate values.It returns logical value.
IsCommon.Name: IsCommon

IsCurrentVar.Description: This function will returns FALSE if variable value is blank or sysname or 'Stock-In-Hand' or otherwise it will return TRUE.
IsCurrentVar.Name: IsCurrentVar

IsDefaultVar.Description: This function will return FALSE if variable value is blank or 'Default' otherwise it will return TRUE.
IsDefaultVar.Name: IsDefaultVar

IsSysNameVar.Description: The function $$IsSysNameVar is to check whether the specified variable name is system variable name or not.  If the Variable is a System Variable then it returns a logical value 'Yes' otherwise it returns a logical value 'No'.
IsSysNameVar.Name: IsSysNameVar

LowValue.Description: Gives the beginning date for the current periodicity. For Example, when you select Quarterly, Half Yearly or Yearly as a periodicity in the report it will return the beginning date for that period.
LowValue.Name: LowValue

NumSets.Description: Gives the number of Columns in the Report.
NumSets.Name: NumSets

ParentFieldVar.Description: It gets the field variable value from its parent report. Using this function varibale defined in the parent report can be accessd by Drill down Reports. Here Parameter Type we pass need not be a System Variable.
ParentFieldVar.Name: ParentFieldVar
